intro: Hieracium basitrichum, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its yellow flowers bloom from July to September, and the plant produces small, oval-shaped achenes as fruits. Hieracium basitrichum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
